awd_titl_txt: Antisedimentation Dialysis:  Fundamentals and Applications  in Membrane Characterization, Fractionation of Macrosolutes,and Simulation of Microgravity
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal studies a dialysis flow cell which has been                       formulated by the PI and is termed an "antisedimentation                        dialysis system." In this system, two streams containing                        solute particles and solvent flow countercurrently in channels                  which are placed on opposite sides of a semipermeable dialysis                  membrane.  The exits of each channel contain a barrier                          membrane which allows only passage of the solvent.  When the                    dialysis membrane does not permit passage of solute, strong                     solute gradients in the flow direction develop as solute piles                  up at the flow exit barriers.  For a semipermeable dialysis                     membrane, solute transport reduces these gradients and causes                   the concentration to become more uniform.  This process can be                  used to measure hindered diffusion coefficients of solute                       through the pores of the semipermeable dialysis membrane                        barrier, and more importantly, can be used in fractionating                     solutes.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
